meanings.definition: Lacking initiative or strength of character; irresponsible.
meanings.sent1: Her fecklessness in completing tasks on time led to her getting in trouble.
meanings.sent2: His fecklessness in making decisions often caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The fecklessness of the cat in catching the mouse was both amusing and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The fecklessness of the old car's engine made it unreliable for long trips.
meanings.sent5: The fecklessness of the student's excuses for not doing homework was evident to everyone.

meanings.sent1: The team's fecklessness in executing the game plan resulted in a humiliating defeat.
meanings.sent2: The company suffered due to the fecklessness of its management in handling finances.
meanings.sent3: The fecklessness of the umbrella during the storm left me completely drenched.
meanings.sent4: The fecklessness of the broken compass led us in circles in the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The fecklessness of the flashlight's batteries in the dark cave left us stranded.
